page.title: 06THE DISTILLERY IN EDDERTON
page.content: Edderton has Scotland's second oldest {Whisky Distillery}called{Balblair.}It was built in 1749.It now employs 16 people,8 of which are from Edderton.2 of the 16 are ladies.Half of the employees are shift workers and the other half are day workers. The Distillery is open all year round 24 hours a day, 7 days a week producing one and a half million litres of whisky a year.From start to finish the process takes 3 days.Then the whisky matures in oak barrels for 3 years but if you require malt whisky it takes 8 years.The whisky is transported south by lorry where most of it is blended with other whiskies but the 8 year old malt is bottled and sold as{Balblair. {The Craigroy River}supplies the water required by the{Distillery.}It is now quite a tourist attraction with 500 visitors annually.
